papers.title: Adsorption of Phosphate in Aqueous Phase by Biochar Prepared from Sheep Manure and Oyster Shells
papers.abstract_snippet: Phosphate adsorption by Ca-modified biochar could be described as chemical monolayer adsorption. Maximum adsorption capacity reached 146.28 mg P/g through Ca²⁺ reaction with PO₄³⁻. The process showed favorable adsorption characteristics with pseudo-second-order kinetics.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Demonstrates calcium-modified biochar's effectiveness for phosphate adsorption with detailed mechanism analysis

papers.title: Significant Improvement of Adsorption for Phosphate Removal by Lanthanum-Loaded Biochar
papers.abstract_snippet: Lanthanum-loaded biochar achieved 666.67 mg/g phosphate adsorption capacity through electrostatic attraction and complexation mechanisms. Material showed 75.1% removal efficiency after 5 regeneration cycles.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Presents novel metal-modified biochar with exceptional phosphate adsorption performance and reusability

papers.title: Novel Fe/Ca Oxide Co-Embedded Coconut Shell Biochar for Phosphorus Recovery from Agricultural Return Flows
papers.abstract_snippet: Fe/Ca oxide co-embedded biochar showed 53.31 mg/g phosphate adsorption capacity through Ca₃(PO₄)₂ precipitation and electrostatic interactions. Effective across pH 6-12 with agricultural wastewater applications.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Demonstrates hybrid metal-biochar composites for sustainable phosphorus recovery in agricultural systems

papers.title: Adsorption of Phosphate over Novel Magnesium-Loaded Sludge Biochar: Mechanisms and Application Potential
papers.abstract_snippet: Mg-modified sludge biochar achieved enhanced phosphate adsorption through MgO crystalline formation and pore structure modification. Showed potential for wastewater treatment applications.
papers.relevance_explanation_from_llm: Explores waste-derived biochar modification for sustainable phosphate removal solutions
